attributes.action: Cease all privilage and payment to MPs until majority is found on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: On 27/03/19 Parliament voted down 8 different ways forward in the Brexit deadlock. No consensus can be reached and it becomes increasingly damaging to future prospects for the UK. The people are left in limbo once again as the Prime minister offers her resignation to secure a deal that has been voted down twice previously and is not the preffered option of any of the electorate.
attributes.background: Government and Parliament are not working towards a best outcome for the people of the United Kingdom. We have lost credibility on the world stage and suffer a greater public divide than ever before as the future of the nation is held to ransom by  Conservative leadership struggles. Stop paying them

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.
You can find out how to contact IPSA here:
http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
